div.p: Greetings. Until this day, dearest Bullinger in the Lord, nothing has been done or decided regarding my calling; for many of the lords are absent, whose presence is desired for this matter. Haller is also absent, as I hear he has gone beyond Lausanne to Geneva, but he is expected back by tomorrow. Yesterday and today I appeared in the council, but in vain due to the aforementioned reasons. At this hour, I have been ordered to send my companion back to you, whom they dismissed with an honorarium of 2 florins beyond the reimbursement of expenses. Therefore, having dismissed him, I await here to see what the council will decide. In the meantime, I commend to your faith my wife and children. As it appears, I will not return to you until the synods are completed, so it is likely that I will remain here for a period of 3 weeks. My wife will not have enough money; for I only gave her 2 florins when I left. I therefore beg you, if it is necessary, to give her as much as necessity requires. When I return, I will repay in good faith. Farewell excellently, dearest of men. Greetings to your whole household and to the other lords and my brothers, Mr. Pellican, Mr. Theodor, and Walter.
The brothers here greet you, and Eberhard also, in Bern, February 26, 1549.
Wolfgang Musculus, yours in the Lord.
